column1: Retalhuleu (Spanish pronunciation: [retaluˈlew]) is a department located in the south-west of Guatemala
column2: extending from the mountains to the Pacific Ocean coast.  It has an area of 1856 km².  In 2018 the population of the Department of Retalhuleu was 326
column3: 828. The capital is the city of Retalhuleu.

column1: The largest Native American group in the state is the K'iche' (Quiché) Maya people.  The department contains a number of Pre-Columbian ruins
The Department is divided into nine municipalities:
Tropical savanna climates have monthly mean temperature above 18 °C (64 °F) in every month of the year and typically a pronounced dry season
column2: with the driest month having precipitation less than 60mm (2.36 in) of precipitation.  The Köppen Climate Classification subtype for this climate is "Aw". (Tropical Savanna Climate).
